abstract: A fan from an unlikely borough remembers Bobby Thomson's home run and the unusual path to backing the New York Giants for a lifetime.
snippet: A fan from an unlikely borough remembers Bobby Thomson's home run and the unusual path to backing the New York Giants for a lifetime.
lead_paragraph: Perhaps it's the amateur historian in me, but I gravitate to people who have experienced first-hand things I wish I had, too. Bobby Thomson's game-ending home run that won the 1951 National League pennant for the New York Giants - and made a goat out of Ralph Branca of the Brooklyn Dodgers - is one of those experiences.
